column1: A company claims that the average weight of their product packages is 500 grams. A quality control inspector randomly selects 10 packages and weighs them. Test whether the company's claim is valid at a 5% significance level.

column2: μ ≠ 500 (The mean weight is not 500 grams)
Fail to Reject the Null Hypothesis
At the 5% significance level, there is not enough evidence to reject the company's claim that the average package weight is 500 grams.

column1: The sample data supports the company's claim. The packages appear to have an average weight consistent with 500 grams.
